intro: Ipomopsis congesta subsp. crebrifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf ipomopsis, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from blue to purple. The subspecies is distinguished by its densely packed leaves and its ability to thrive in rocky, arid environments. It typically grows in open habitats such as sagebrush steppe and grasslands. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small seeds, which are dispersed by wind.
